intro: Anemia nipeensis, commonly known as the Nipean fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity. Anemia nipeensis is also of interest to botanists due to its potential medicinal properties.
